ground_truth: Peter stares through his dark-rimmed spectacles, then blinks. A lone figure stands on the flat roof of a tall Manhattan building. Down below, a street with four lanes of parked traffic. Across from it, another flat-roofed building. The figure is Peter, who strides with purpose away from the edge. His face full of resolve, he stops. Peter runs towards it, past the skylight jutting up, his face set in grim determination. His jaw clenched, his teeth gritted. He pumps his arms forward and back, as his pace increases and his stride lengthens. Pigeons take to the air as Peter passes. His eyes are focused on where he's going. He flings both arms back, then thrusts them forward as he leaps off the roof. His arms and legs flailing, he soars through the air. A washing line breaks his fall. He swings on it against the wall, onto the roof of a car, rolls off it, and hits another vehicle. He lifts himself up. He looks to see how far he's fallen, clutches his back, and hobbles between the cars and out of the alley parking lot. He leans on a parked car for support. John's at MJ's. MJ opens wedding acceptance cards. He kisses her outstretched hand. She studies him closely. He's lying on the sofa. He turns over and tips his head back on a cushion on the arm of the sofa. MJ, on her knees, leans over him, kissing him full on the lips, her head pointing the opposite way from his. He stretches out his left hand and holds her head still. MJ moves her head away and closes her mouth and her eyes. MJ's lost in memories. Her long hair trails down over his cheek, until MJ pulls back. She opens her mouth in a silent sigh and looks sad and reflective. MJ is sitting in a cafe with a glass front, leaning her head on her hand. Peter strolls in, and sits opposite her. He looks down as she stares intently into his face. Her eyes are fixed on him. Her face grows sad. He shakes his head. MJ purses her lips. Her eyes flit left and right. His head shakes slightly, as he gazes sorrowfully into her blue eyes. He looks at the table. She lowers her head, then raises it. Tears well in MJ's eyes. Her lips quiver. She leans forward. Peter looks up, surprised. She lays her hand on his. Her engagement ring shines brightly. Peter's eyes move up from her hand to her face. She stretches further across the table. He edges his mouth closer to hers, then stops. Her eyes are closed. Her lips offer to him. His eyes widen as a car comes flying towards the window.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description:
Sure, here is the text with synonyms replacing non-stop-words:

Peter gazes through his dark-edged glasses, then blinks. A solitary silhouette stands on the level rooftop of a tall Manhattan structure. Down below, a roadway with four lanes of parked vehicles. Across from it, another flat-roofed structure. The silhouette is Peter, who strides with determination away from the brink. His visage full of resolve, he halts. Peter sprints towards it, past the skylight protruding upward, his face set in grim determination. His jaw clenched, his teeth gritted. He pumps his limbs forward and back, as his speed increases and his stride lengthens. Pigeons take to the sky as Peter passes. His eyes are concentrated on where he's heading. He flings both arms backward, then thrusts them forward as he vaults off the rooftop. His limbs flailing, he soars through the sky. A washing line interrupts his fall. He swings on it against the wall, onto the roof of a vehicle, rolls off it, and impacts another vehicle. He raises himself up. He surveys to see how far he's descended, clutches his back, and hobbles between the vehicles and out of the alley parking area. He leans on a parked vehicle for support. John's at MJ's. MJ opens wedding acceptance cards. He kisses her extended hand. She scrutinizes him closely. He's reclining on the sofa. He turns over and tips his head back on a cushion on the arm of the sofa. MJ, on her knees, leans over him, kissing him fully on the lips, her head pointing the opposite direction from his. He extends his left hand and holds her head still. MJ moves her head away and closes her mouth and her eyes. MJ's lost in recollections. Her long tresses trail down over his cheek, until MJ pulls back. She opens her mouth in a silent sigh and looks sad and pensive. MJ is sitting in a café with a glass front, leaning her head on her hand. Peter strolls in, and sits facing her. He looks down as she stares intently into his face. Her eyes are fixed on him. Her face grows sorrowful. He shakes his head. MJ purses her lips. Her eyes flit left and right. His head shakes slightly, as he gazes sorrowfully into her blue eyes. He looks at the surface. She lowers her head, then raises it. Tears swell in MJ's eyes. Her lips quiver. She leans forward. Peter looks up, surprised. She lays her hand on his. Her engagement ring gleams brightly. Peter's eyes move up from her hand to her face. She stretches further across the surface. He edges his mouth closer to hers, then stops. Her eyes are closed. Her lips offer to him. His eyes widen as a vehicle comes flying towards the window.

Down below, a street with four lanes of parked traffic can be seen. Across from it stands another flat-roofed building. The figure was Peter, who is now striding with purpose away from the edge. On where he's going, his eyes are focused. Both arms are flung back by him, then thrust forward as he leaps off the roof. Through the air, he soars, his arms and legs flailing. His fall is broken by a washing line. On it, he swings against the wall, onto the roof of a car, rolls off it, and hits another vehicle. Himself up is lifted by him. To see how far he's fallen, he looks, clutches his back, and between the cars and out of the alley parking lot, hobbles. For support, a parked car is leaned on by him. MJ is at John's. Wedding acceptance cards are opened by MJ. Her outstretched hand is kissed by him. Him is studied closely by her. On the sofa, he's lying. Over, he turns and back on a cushion on the arm of the sofa, his head is tipped by him. On her knees, MJ leans over him, kissing him full on the lips, her head pointing the opposite way from his. Her head is held still by him, as his left hand is stretched out. Her head is moved away by MJ, and her mouth and her eyes are closed. Lost in memories, MJ is. Over his cheek, her long hair trails down, until back is pulled by MJ. In a silent sigh, her mouth is opened by her, and sad and reflective, she looks. With a glass front, MJ is sitting in a café, leaning her head on her hand. Into the café, Peter strolls, and opposite her, he sits. Down, he looks, as into his face, she stares intently. On him, her eyes are fixed. Sadness is grown on her face. His head is shaken by him. Her lips are pursed by MJ. Left and right, her eyes flit. Slightly, his head shakes, as sorrowfully into her blue eyes, he gazes. At the table, he looks. Her head is lowered, then raised by her. In MJ's eyes, tears well. Her lips quiver. Forward, she leans. Up, Peter looks, surprised. On his, her hand is laid by her. Brightly, her engagement ring shines. From her hand to her face, Peter's eyes move. Further across the table, she stretches. Closer to hers, he edges his mouth, then stops. Her eyes are closed. To him, her lips offer. Widen, his eyes do as towards the window, a car comes flying.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description:
Peter peers through his dark-rimmed glasses and blinks. On a Manhattan building's roof, a lone figure stands. Below is a busy four-lane street, with another flat-roofed building across it. The figure is Peter, striding purposefully away from the edge. Determined, he runs past a skylight, jaw clenched, arms pumping as his pace quickens. Pigeons scatter as he flies off the roof. He breaks his fall on a washing line, swings, lands on a car's roof, rolls, and hits another vehicle. He clutches his back, hobbling out of the alley. Leaning on a parked car, he catches his breath. 

John visits MJ, who is opening wedding cards. He kisses her hand as she studies him. Lying on the sofa, they kiss, her hair trailing over him. MJ pulls back, lost in thought, then sighs silently, appearing sad. Later, in a cafe, Peter sits opposite her. MJ's eyes fix on him, her face sad. They exchange sorrowful glances before tears well in her eyes. She places her hand on his, her engagement ring gleaming. As they lean closer, a car hurtles toward the window, halting their moment.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Peter, in dark-rimmed spectacles, blinks at a lone figure on a Manhattan building's roof. It's him, Peter, moving away from the edge with resolve. He runs, jaw clenched, past a skylight, propelling himself forward. Pigeons scatter as he leaps off the roof, flailing through the air. A washing line breaks his fall as he swings into a car, rolls off, and hits another vehicle. He rises, clutching his back, and hobbles between cars, leaning for support. John is at MJ's, who examines wedding acceptance cards. He kisses her hand. She leans over him on the sofa, kissing him. Her hair trails over him until she pulls back, looking reflective. At a café, MJ, sad, leans her head on her hand. Peter enters and sits opposite her. She stares intently as he gazes sorrowfully into her eyes, then looks down. Tears well in her eyes; her lips quiver as she lays her hand on his, her engagement ring shining. Peter, surprised, moves closer, her lips offering to him. His eyes widen as a car approaches the window.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Peter gazes intently through the lenses of his dark-rimmed spectacles, blinking thoughtfully as he takes in the scene before him. A solitary figure stands poised on the flat rooftop of a towering Manhattan building, casting a long shadow in the city's vibrant skyline. Below, a busy street is alive with four lanes of cars, tightly packed in parked formation. Opposite the street, another building with a flat roof stands quiet and unassuming. The figure, determined and unwavering, is indeed Peter himself. With a purposeful stride, he moves decisively away from the roof's edge, his expression resolute and unyielding. Coming to a stop, he suddenly breaks into a run, speeding past the protruding skylight with his eyes set in grim determination. His jaw is tightly clenched, and his teeth are gritted as he propels his arms forward and backward in rhythm, gradually increasing his pace and lengthening his stride. As Peter races by, pigeons flutter into the air, startled by his swift movements. His eyes are unwaveringly focused on his destination. With a mighty leap, he hurls both arms back before thrusting them forward, flinging himself off the roof with abandon. As he soars through the air, his arms and legs flail in a chaotic yet controlled manner. A washing line interrupts his descent, absorbing some of the impact as he swings against the adjacent wall and onto the hood of a car. Rolling off the vehicle, he lands on another parked car, hitting it with a thud. Determined, he hoists himself up, glancing back to gauge the distance he has fallen. Clutching his aching back, Peter hobbles through the narrow alley, weaving between the closely parked cars. He leans heavily on the hood of one for support as he continues onward.

Meanwhile, John is at MJ's place, where the atmosphere is serene yet filled with anticipation. MJ is absorbed in opening wedding acceptance cards, and as John embraces the moment, he places a gentle kiss on her outstretched hand. She regards him with a look of curiosity and affection, her eyes searching his face for unspoken words. Reclined on the sofa, he turns over and rests his head on the cushion that covers the sofa's armrest. MJ, kneeling beside him, leans over to plant a soft kiss on his lips, her head tilted in the opposite direction from his. He reaches out with his left hand, tenderly holding her head steady. As MJ gradually pulls away, her eyes close and her lips form a silent sigh, hinting at the memories lost in her mind. Her long, flowing hair brushes lightly against his cheek before MJ withdraws fully, her expression turning wistful and reflective.

Later, MJ finds herself seated in a cozy café with a glass-fronted façade, resting her head pensively on her hand. Peter enters the café, strolling casually, and takes a seat directly across from her. As he lowers his gaze, MJ fixes her intense stare on his face, her eyes searching deeply for answers. Her facial expression slowly morphs into one of sadness. Peter shakes his head subtly, a gesture laden with unspoken emotion. MJ purses her lips tightly, her eyes darting left and right as if seeking escape. His head continues its gentle shake, as he looks sorrowfully into her deep blue eyes, then shifts his focus to the table before them. MJ lowers her head briefly before lifting it again. Tears begin to well up in her eyes, her lips trembling slightly. As she leans forward, Peter looks up, caught off-guard by her proximity. She places her hand gently on his, the engagement ring on her finger gleaming brightly in the café's soft light. Peter's gaze slowly moves up from her hand to meet her face. She leans even further across the table, and he inches his mouth closer to hers, only to suddenly pause. Her eyes are closed, her lips poised in an offering of affection. In an instant, his eyes widen in shock as a car comes hurtling toward the café window, shattering the moment into fragments.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Peter, with unwavering focus, peers intently through the lenses of his dark-rimmed spectacles. He blinks thoughtfully, absorbing the entire scene unfolding before him. A solitary figure stands poised on the expansive, flat rooftop of a towering Manhattan building, casting an elongated shadow amidst the vibrant skyline of the bustling city. Below this lofty perch, a busy street is alive with activity, featuring four tightly packed lanes of cars, all parked in a neat formation. Across the street, another building with a flat roof stands quietly, unassuming and undisturbed by the city's hum. The determined and unwavering figure on the rooftop is none other than Peter himself. With a stride full of purpose, he moves away from the edge of the roof in a decisive manner, his expression resolute and unwavering. Coming to a halt, he suddenly bursts into a run, speeding past the protruding skylight with his eyes fixed in unyielding determination. His jaw is tightly clenched, and his teeth are gritted as he rhythmically propels his arms forward and backward, steadily increasing his pace and lengthening his stride. As Peter races by, pigeons, startled by his swift movements, take to the air in a flutter. His eyes remain unwaveringly focused on his destination. With a mighty leap, he swings both arms back before thrusting them forward with force, launching himself off the roof with reckless abandon. As he soars through the air, his arms and legs flail in a chaotic yet controlled manner. A washing line interrupts his descent, absorbing some of the impact as he swings against the adjacent wall and onto the hood of a car. Rolling off the vehicle, he lands on another parked car, hitting it with a resounding thud. Determined beyond measure, he hoists himself up, taking a glance back to gauge the impressive distance he has fallen. Clutching his aching back, Peter hobbles forward through the narrow alley, weaving between the closely parked cars. He leans heavily on the hood of one for much-needed support as he continues his path onward.

Meanwhile, over at MJ's place, John finds himself enveloped in an atmosphere that is serene, yet brimming with anticipation. MJ is deeply absorbed in the task of opening wedding acceptance cards, and as John savors the moment, he gently kisses her outstretched hand. She regards him with a look of affectionate curiosity, her eyes intently searching his face for unspoken words and hidden meanings. Reclined comfortably on the sofa, John turns over and rests his head against the cushion that covers the sofa's supportive armrest. MJ, kneeling beside him, leans over to plant a soft and tender kiss on his lips, her head tilted in the opposite direction from his. He reaches out with his left hand, tenderly cradling her head to hold it steady. As MJ gradually pulls away, her eyes close, and her lips form a silent sigh, hinting at the fond memories swirling in her mind. Her long, flowing hair brushes lightly against his cheek before MJ fully withdraws, her expression gradually transforming into one of wistful reflection.

Later on, MJ finds herself seated in a cozy, inviting café with a glass-fronted façade. She rests her head pensively on her hand. Peter enters the café, strolling with an air of casual ease, and takes a seat directly across the table from her. As he lowers his gaze thoughtfully, MJ fixes her intense stare on his face, her eyes probing deeply for answers. Her facial expression slowly transforms into one of sadness. Peter subtly shakes his head, a gesture laden with unspoken emotion. MJ purses her lips tightly, her eyes darting left and right, as if seeking some form of escape from the moment. His head continues its gentle shake, as he looks sorrowfully into her deep blue eyes, then shifts his focus to the table before them. MJ lowers her head briefly before lifting it once more. Tears gradually begin to well up in her eyes, her lips trembling slightly with emotion. As she leans forward, Peter looks up, momentarily caught off-guard by her sudden proximity. She places her hand gently on his, the engagement ring on her finger gleaming brightly in the café's softly illuminating light. Peter's gaze slowly moves up from her hand to meet her face. She leans even further across the table, and he inches his mouth closer to hers, only to suddenly pause. Her eyes are closed, her lips posed in an offering of affection. In an instant, his eyes widen in shock as a car comes hurtling toward the café window, shattering the moment into countless fragments.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Peter gazes intently through his dark-rimmed spectacles, taking in the scene before him with a steady stare and a brief blink that momentarily interrupts his focus. A solitary figure is positioned on the flat roof of a towering Manhattan building, silhouetted against the sky. Below, the bustling city life is captured by a street where four lanes of stationary traffic are lined up in neat rows. Directly across from this scene is another building, its roof equally flat. The figure, now clearly identified as Peter, propels himself forward with determination, purposefully moving away from the perilous edge of the rooftop. His expression is one of unwavering resolve as he comes to a temporary halt, gathering his thoughts. In a sudden burst of energy, Peter begins to sprint, his destination clear in his mind. He swiftly navigates past a protruding skylight, his face etched with grim determination, his jaw set tightly, and his teeth firmly gritted together. As he runs, he rhythmically pumps his arms frontward and back, each motion contributing to his increasing speed. His strides become longer, more powerful. The sudden flurry of movement disturbs a flock of pigeons, which burst into flight as Peter rushes by, his eyes unwaveringly fixated on his intended trajectory. With a strategic fling of both arms backward, followed by a forceful launch forward, Peter propels himself off the edge of the roof, committing fully to the leap. As he sails through the air, his limbs move in an instinctive, almost frantic manner, seeking balance and control in the void. His descent is abruptly checked by a washing line, which partially absorbs the impact, allowing him to swing towards a nearby wall. This unplanned swing directs him onto the roof of a parked car, where he lands with a thud, then expertly rolls off the vehicle before colliding with another car parked nearby. Gathering his breath and composure, Peter slowly picks himself up, taking stock of the height he's just fallen. Pain pulses through his back, prompting him to clutch it as he hobbles away from the scene, maneuvering cautiously between the parked cars and finally escaping the confines of the alley parking lot. Seeking stability, he leans heavily against a car, momentarily catching his breath. Meanwhile, John is at MJ's place, where MJ is preoccupied with opening wedding acceptance cards. John affectionately kisses her outstretched hand, prompting MJ to observe him closely with a discerning eye. He has reclined comfortably on the sofa, and in a relaxed movement, he turns over, allowing his head to rest heavily against a cushion positioned on the arm of the sofa. MJ, positioned on her knees beside him, leans forward to kiss him passionately on the lips, her head tilted at an angle opposite to his. In response, he gently extends his left hand to cradle her head, keeping it steady. Eventually, MJ withdraws slightly, closing her mouth and eyes, succumbing to a tide of memories. Her cascading hair brushes against his cheek but is soon drawn back as MJ disengages, releasing a silent, mournful sigh. Her expression turns wistful, tinged with sadness and reflection. Transitioning to a new scene, MJ is now seated in a cafe with large glass windows, where she rests her head pensively on her hand. Peter calmly enters the cafe and takes a seat directly across from her. As MJ fixes an intense gaze upon him, he avoids direct eye contact, choosing instead to look down. Her stare remains unyielding, yet her expression begins to convey a deep sadness. Peter subtly shakes his head, a silent gesture of negation, as MJ's lips tighten in response. Her eyes flicker side to side, searching, perhaps, for answers. Peter's head continues to move slightly in a slow shake, his gaze filled with sorrow as he meets her blue eyes. He momentarily breaks eye contact to look down at the table. Gradually, MJ lowers her head, then lifts it again, the emotional weight causing tears to form in her eyes. Her lips tremble with the effort of holding back her emotions. Leaning forward, she reaches out, catching Peter's attention and surprise. Gently, she places her hand atop his, the engagement ring on her finger catching the light and gleaming brightly. Peter's gaze lifts from her hand to meet her face, taking in the significance of the moment. MJ leans further across the table, and Peter instinctively inches his mouth closer to hers, but hesitates, pausing for a moment. As MJ's eyes close, her lips emerge in a silent invitation. At that precise moment, Peter's eyes widen in alarm as he detects a fast-approaching car hurtling towards the cafe window, shattering the intimate tension of the moment.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Peter observes the scene through his dark-rimmed spectacles before striding purposefully away from the edge of a tall Manhattan building. With determined focus, he accelerates past the jutting skylight, propelling himself off the roof with a powerful leap. Soaring through the air, he breaks his fall with a washing line, swings onto a car roof, rolls off, and hits another vehicle. After assessing the fall, clutching his back, and leaning on a parked car for support, he hobbles out of the alley parking lot. Elsewhere, John is with MJ, who opens wedding acceptance cards. As they share a tender moment on the sofa, MJ studies him closely, kisses him, and gets lost in memories. Her hair brushes his cheek before she pulls back, looking sad and reflective. Later, MJ sits in a cafe, leaning her head on her hand. When Peter arrives and sits opposite her, they share a silent, sorrowful exchange. MJ’s eyes well with tears as she reaches across the table to lay her hand on his, her engagement ring catching the light. Peter gazes at her face, just as a car hurtles toward the window.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Peter stares through his dark-rimmed spectacles, which were a gift from his late grandmother, then blinks. A lone figure stands on the flat roof of a tall Manhattan building, an architectural marvel known for its art deco style. Down below, a street with four lanes of parked traffic, typical of the city's bustling avenues. Across from it, another flat-roofed building that houses one of the city's oldest newspapers. The figure is Peter, who strides with purpose away from the edge, a scene reminiscent of classic action films set in the city that never sleeps. His face full of resolve, he stops. Peter runs towards it, past the skylight jutting up, his face set in grim determination as if pursuing a personal vendetta. His jaw clenched, his teeth gritted. He pumps his arms forward and back, as his pace increases and his stride lengthens. Pigeons, often seen as symbols of urban life, take to the air as Peter passes. His eyes are focused on where he's going. He flings both arms back, then thrusts them forward as he leaps off the roof, channeling the spirit of daring city adventurers from New York's rich history. His arms and legs flailing, he soars through the air. A washing line, a common sight strung between old apartment buildings, breaks his fall. He swings on it against the wall, onto the roof of a car, rolls off it, and hits another vehicle parked haphazardly like many in the crowded city. He lifts himself up. He looks to see how far he's fallen, clutches his back, and hobbles between the cars and out of the alley parking lot. He leans on a parked car for support. John’s at MJ’s, a cozy apartment filled with sunlight from large windows. MJ opens wedding acceptance cards, their elaborate designs hinting at an extravagant upcoming ceremony. He kisses her outstretched hand. She studies him closely, noticing the changes since their last reunion. He's lying on the sofa. He turns over and tips his head back on a cushion on the arm of the sofa, a piece of furniture that has seen countless gatherings. MJ, on her knees, leans over him, kissing him full on the lips, her head pointing the opposite way from his. He stretches out his left hand and holds her head still. MJ moves her head away and closes her mouth and her eyes, reminiscent of a dramatic scene from a romance novel. MJ’s lost in memories, recalling their shared moments. Her long hair trails down over his cheek, until MJ pulls back. She opens her mouth in a silent sigh and looks sad and reflective, her mind wandering to what could have been. MJ is sitting in a cafe with a glass front, a popular spot known for its artisanal coffee, leaning her head on her hand. Peter strolls in, and sits opposite her. He looks down as she stares intently into his face. Her eyes are fixed on him. Her face grows sad. He shakes his head, conveying unspoken words of regret. MJ purses her lips. Her eyes flit left and right, capturing the din of the bustling cafe. His head shakes slightly, as he gazes sorrowfully into her blue eyes. He looks at the table. She lowers her head, then raises it. Tears well in MJ’s eyes. Her lips quiver. She leans forward. Peter looks up, surprised. She lays her hand on his. Her engagement ring shines brightly, a symbol of unfulfilled promises. Peter’s eyes move up from her hand to her face. She stretches further across the table. He edges his mouth closer to hers, then stops. Her eyes are closed. Her lips offer to him. His eyes widen as a car comes flying towards the window, shattering the tranquility of their poignant moment.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. He stretches out his left hand and holds her head still. MJ moves her head away and closes her mouth and her eyes. MJ's lost in memories. Her long hair trails down over his cheek until MJ pulls back. She opens her mouth in a silent sigh and looks sad and reflective. MJ is sitting in a cafe with a glass front leaning her head on her hand. Peter strolls in and sits opposite her. He looks down as she stares intently into his face. Her eyes are fixed on him. Her face grows sad. He shakes his head. MJ purses her lips. Her eyes flit left and right. His head shakes slightly as he gazes sorrowfully into her blue eyes. He looks at the table. She lowers her head then raises it. Tears well in MJ's eyes. Her lips quiver. She leans forward. Peter looks up surprised. She lays her hand on his. Her engagement ring shines brightly. Peter's eyes move up from her hand to her face. She stretches further across the table. He edges his mouth closer to hers then stops. Her eyes are closed. Her lips offer to him. His eyes widen as a car comes flying towards the window.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Peter stares through his darkrimmed spectacles then blinks. A lone figure stands on the flat roof of a tall Manhattan building. Down below a street with four lanes of parked traffic. Across from it another flatroofed building. The figure is Peter who strides with purpose away from the edge. His face full of resolve. he stops. Peter runs towards it past the skylight jutting up his face set in grim determination. His jaw clenched his teeth gritted. He pumps his arms forward and back as his pace increases and his stride lengthens. Pigeons take to the air as Peter passes. His eyes are focused on where he is going. He flings both arms back then thrusts them forward as he leaps off the roof. His arms and legs flailing. he soars through the air. A washing line breaks his fall. He swings on it against the wall onto the roof of a car rolls off it and hits another vehicle. He lifts himself up. He looks to see how far he is fallen clutches his back and hobbles between the cars and out of the alley parking lot. He leans on a parked car for support. John's at MJ's. MJ opens wedding acceptance cards. He kisses her outstretched hand. She studies him closely. He is lying on the sofa. He turns over and tips his head back on a cushion on the arm of the sofa. MJ on her knees leans over him kissing him full on the lips her head pointing the opposite way from his. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Sandra glares through her oversized binoculars, then yawns. A solitary canine poses on the sloped roof of a short Brussels skyscraper. Up above, a river with seven bridges of floating debris. Adjacent to it, another sloped-roofed skyscraper. The canine is Sandra, who slips with hesitation toward the chimney. Her expression full of confusion, she pauses. Sandra crawls away from it, past the antenna sticking out, her expression one of mild curiosity. Her lips pursed, her fingers wiggling. She spins her legs left and right, as her speed stabilizes and her stance narrows. Sparrows drift to the soil as Sandra crawls. Her ears are alert to where she's coming. She flaps both legs out, then snaps them inward as she slides onto the chimney. Her legs and torso flapping, she glides through the fog. A flagpole disrupts her descent. She twirls on it beside the railing, onto the surface of a dumpster, bounces off it, and grazes another bicycle. She lifts herself down. She glances to measure how long she's climbed, pinches her shoulder, and skips past the bicycles and out of the garden garage. She stretches on a leaning bicycle for balance. Martin's at Kelly's. Kelly sorts birthday rejection letters. He pats her reluctant elbow. She examines him lazily. He's reclining on the recliner. He rolls forward and drops his chin on a doily on the edge of the recliner. Kelly, on her feet, stands over him, slapping him gently on the forehead, her chin tilting the same way as his. He stretches out his right foot and taps her forehead lightly. Kelly moves her forehead still and opens her eyes and her mouth. Kelly's trapped in daydreams. Her short scarf droops softly over his neck, until Kelly pushes away. She shuts her eyes in a loud yawn and feels cheery and excited. Kelly is strolling in a library with a dusty door, resting her chin on her foot. Sandra dances in, and stands above her. She glances up as he glares gently into her nose. His fingers are fastened on her. His fingers grow happy. She shakes her leg. Kelly puckers her ears. His fingers dance up and down. Her leg nods slightly, as she glares mirthfully into his brown fingers. He glances at the clock. She raises her legs, then drops them. Insects fly from Kelly’s ears. Her eyes twitch. She hangs back. Sandra glances down, astonished. He raises his finger on hers. Her friendship bracelet dims quietly. Sandra’s ears drop down from her finger to her nose. He shrinks further across the clock. She shields her nose closer to his, then rises. His fingers stay wide. His nose narrows as a kite floats gliding past the door.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Peter stands on a Manhattan rooftop, determined, and runs with purpose, leaping off the building. He crashes onto a washing line, falls onto a car, and stumbles out of an alley. Meanwhile, John is at MJ's, and they share a moment on the sofa as she reflects on her memories, feeling sad and nostalgic. Later, MJ sits in a café, where Peter joins her. As they sit opposite each other, MJ's face grows sad, and tears well in her eyes. She reaches for Peter's hand, showing her engagement ring. Just as Peter moves closer for a kiss, a car comes flying toward the window.
